acc_hardware.Description: Which acc hardware to use on boards with more than one device

acc_ins_lpf.Description: ACC lowpass for Acc GPS INS

acc_lpf.Description: Set the Low Pass Filter factor for ACC. Increasing this value would reduce ACC noise (visible in GUI), but would increase ACC lag time. Zero = no filter

acc_zalt_cf.Description: Crashpilot: Value for complementary filter accz and altitude

acc_zvel_cf.Description: Crashpilot: Value for complementary filter accz and barovelocity

al_baro_lr.Description: Temporary value "64" increase to increase Landingspeed

al_debounce.Description: (0-20%) 0 Disables. Defines a Throttlelimiter on Autoland. This percentage defines the maximum deviation of assumed hoverthrottle during Autoland

algn_acc_x.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_acc_y.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_acc_z.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_gyro_x.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_gyro_y.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_gyro_z.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_mag_x.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_mag_y.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

algn_mag_z.Description: acc, gyro, mag alignment (ex: with sensor output of X, Y, Z, align of 1 -3 2 would return X, -Z, Y)

al_lndthr.Description: This is the absolute throttle that kicks off the "has landed timer" if it is "0" or too low cfg.minthrottle is taken.

al_snrlr.Description: You can specify different landingfactor here on sonar contact, because sonar land maybe too fast...

al_tobaro.Description: Timeout in ms (100 - 5000) before shutoff on autoland. "al_lndthr" must be undershot for that timeperiod

al_tosnr.Description: Timeout in ms (100 - 5000) If sonar aided land is wanted (snr_land = 1) you can choose a different timeout here

alt_thrmid.Description: defines the neutral zone of throttle stick during altitude hold, default setting is +/-20

esc_maxthr.Description: This is the maximum value for the ESCs at full power this value can be increased up to 2000

esc_mincmd.Description: This is the value for the ESCs when they are not armed. In some cases, this value must be lowered down to 900 for some specific ESCs

esc_minthr.Description: Set the minimum throttle command sent to the ESC (Electronic Speed Controller). This is the minimum value that allow motors to run at a idle speed.

esc_passmotor.Description: Crashpilot: Only used with feature pass. If 0 = all Motors, otherwise specific Motor

fs_deadpilot.Description: Time in sec when FS is engaged after idle on THR/YAW/ROLL/PITCH

fs_delay.Description: Guard time for failsafe activation after signal lost. 1 step = 0.1sec - 1sec in example (10)

fs_ignoresnr.Description: When snr_land is set to 1, it is possible to ignore that on Failsafe, because FS over a tree could turn off copter

fs_justph.Description: Does just PH and Autoland an not RTL,

fs_off_delay.Description: Time for Landing before motors stop in 0.1sec. 1 step = 0.1sec - 20sec in example (200)

fs_thr.Description: Throttle level used for landing - specify value between 1000..2000 (pwm pulse width for slightly below hover). center throttle = 1500.

gmbl_flags.Description: in servotilt mode, various things that affect stuff

gmbl_pitch_gain.Description: gimbal pitch servo gain (tied to angle) can be negative to invert movement

gmbl_roll_gain.Description: gimbal roll servo gain (tied to angle) can be negative to invert movement

gps_adddb.Description: Additional Deadband for all GPS functions;

gps_ins_mdl.Description: GPS ins model. 1 = Based on lat/lon, 2 = based on Groundcourse and speed, 3 = based on ublx velned
gps_ins_mdl.Values: 1:Based on lat/lon,2:based on Groundcourse and speed,3:based on ublx velned

gps_ins_vel.Description: Crashpilot: Value for complementary filter INS and GPS Velocity

gps_maxangle.Description: maximal over all GPS bank angle

gps_nav_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

gps_phase.Description: Make a phaseshift +-30 Deg max of GPS output

gps_pos_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

gps_posr_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

gps_pt1cut.Description: (1-50Hz) Cuf Off Frequency for D term in Hz of GPS Pid controller

gps_tbe_speed.Description: 0 - 1000 (0 disables) Speed in cm/s for TBE detection must be greater than gps_ph_settlespeed or disabled

gps_type.Description: Type of GPS hardware. 0: NMEA 1: UBX 2+ ??

gps_yaw.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

gyro_cmpf.Description: Set the Gyro Weight for Gyro/Acc complementary filter. Increasing this value would reduce and delay Acc influence on the output of the filter.

gyro_lpf.Description: mpuX050 LPF setting (TODO make it work on L3GD as well)

led_armed.Description: 0 = Show LED only if armed, 1 = always show LED
led_armed.Values: 0:Show LED only if armed,1:always show LED

led_ctrlch.Description: RC Channel to control the LED Pattern

led_pattern1.Description: 32bit bit pattern to have flickering led patterns / the pattern for MWCRGB 1000-2000

led_pattern2.Description: 32bit bit pattern to have flickering led patterns / the pattern for MWCRGB 1000-2000

led_pattern3.Description: 32bit bit pattern to have flickering led patterns / the pattern for MWCRGB 1000-2000

led_pinout.Description: choose LED pinout (MONO_LED: 0=LED rc5, 1=LED rc6 / MWCRGB: coming soon)

led_tgl_delay1.Description: 16bit bit pattern to slow down led patterns

led_tgl_delay2.Description: 16bit bit pattern to slow down led patterns

led_tgl_delay3.Description: 16bit bit pattern to slow down led patterns

mag_oldctime.Description: 1 - 5 Time in MINUTES for old calibration. Use this together with mag_oldcalib = 1 if you have a monster of a copter

main_mixertype.Description: mixtable-presets: TRI, QUADP, QUADX, BI, GIMBAL, Y6, HEX6, FLYING_WING, Y4, HEX6X, OCTOX8, OCTOFLATP, OCTOFLATX, AIRPLANE, HELI_120_CCPM, HELI_90_DEG, VTAIL4, CUSTOM

main_pidctrl.Description: 1 = OriginalMwiiPid pimped by me, 2 = New mwii controller (experimental, float pimped + pt1)

main_pidimax.Description: [10-65000) 256 Default. Imax for Gyropart (incl. Yaw) of new Pidcontroller

main_pt1cut.Description: (0-50Hz) 0 Disables pt1element. Cuf Off Frequency for pt1 element D term in Hz of main Pid controller

moron_threshold.Description: people keep forgetting that moving model while init results in wrong gyro offsets. and then they never reset gyro. so this is now on by default.

nav_approachdiv.Description: 2-10 This is the divisor for approach speed for wp_distance. Example: 400cm / 3 = 133cm/s if below nav_speed_min it will be adjusted

nav_ctrkgain.Description: 0 - 10.0 (Floatvariable) That is the "Crosstrackgain" APM default is "1". "0" disables

nav_heading.Description: 1 = Nav controls YAW during WP ONLY

nav_slew_rate.Description: Adds a rate control to nav output, will smoothen out nav angle spikes

nav_speed_max.Description: 10 - 200 cm/s don't set higher than nav_speed_max! That dumbness is not covered.

nav_speed_min.Description: 10 - 200 cm/s don't set higher than nav_speed_max! That dumbness is not covered.

nav_tail_first.Description: 1 = Copter comes back with ass first (only works with nav_controls_heading = 1)

nav_tiltcomp.Description: 0-100 Only arducopter really knows. This is some kind of a hack of them to reach actual nav_speed_max. 54 was default, 0 disables

ph_abstub.Description: 0 - 1000cm (300 default) Defines the "bath tub" around current absolute PH Position, where PosP is diminished, reaction gets harder on tubs edge and then goes on linear

ph_brkacc.Description: [50-500] Is the assumed negative braking acceleration in cm/(s*s) of copter. Value is positive though

ph_minbrk.Description: 1-99% minimal percent of "brakemaxangle" left over for braking. Example brakemaxangle = 6 so 50 Percent is 3..

ph_minsat.Description: Minimal Satcount for PH, PH on RTL is still done with 5Sats or more

pid_alt_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

pid_level_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

pid_pitch_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

pid_roll_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

pid_yaw_p.Description: Thats the MAG P during GPS functions, substitute for "cfg.P8[PIDMAG]"

pitch_dir_r.Description: right servo - pitch orientation (opposite sign to pitch_direction_l if servos are mounted mirrored)

pwm_rate_motor.Description: The update rate of motor outputs (50-498Hz)

pwm_rate_servo.Description: The update rate of servo outputs (50-498Hz)

rc_aux_chs.Description: cGiesen: the number of supported aux channels. default = 4

rc_deadband.Description: introduce a deadband around the stick center for pitch and roll axis. Must be greater than zero.

rc_killswtime.Description: Time in ms when your arm switch becomes a Killswitch, 0 disables

rc_map_aux1.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_map_aux2.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_map_aux3.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_map_aux4.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_map_pitch.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_map_roll.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_map_thr.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_map_yaw.Description: mapping of radio channels to internal RPYTA+ order

rc_midrc.Description: Some radios have not a neutral point centered on 1500. can be changed here

rc_retarded_arm.Description: allow disarsm/arm on throttle down + roll left/right

rc_yawdeadband.Description: introduce a deadband around the stick center for yaw axis. Must be greater than zero.

roll_dir_r.Description: right servo - roll orientation (same sign as ROLL_DIRECTION_L, if servos are mounted in mirrored orientation)

rtl_flyaway.Description: If during RTL the distance increases beyond this valus in meters, something is wrong, autoland

rtl_mindist.Description: Minimal distance for RTL, otherwise it will just autoland, prevent Failsafe jump in your face, when arming copter and turning off TX

serial_prot.Description: Protocol ONLY used when Armed including Baudchange if necessary. 0 (Dfault)=Keep Multiwii @CurrentUSB Baud, 1=Frsky @9600Baud, 2=Mavlink @CurrentUSB Baud, 3=Mavlink @57KBaud (like stock minimOSD wants it)

snr_debug.Description: 1 Sets Sonardata within snr_min/max in debug[0]

snr_diff.Description: Maximal allowed difference in cm between sonar readouts (100ms rate and maxdiff = 50 means max 5m/s)

snr_land.Description: When snr_land is set to 1, it is possible to ignore that on Failsafe, because FS over a tree could turn off copter

snr_max.Description: Valid Sonar maximal range in cm (0-700)

snr_min.Description: Valid Sonar minimal range in cm (0-200)

snr_tilt.Description: Somehow copter tiltrange in degrees (not exactly) in wich Sonar is possible

tri_yaw_middle.Description: tail servo center pos. - use this for initial trim

vbat_adc_ch.Description: which channel is used for current sensor. Right now, only 2 places are supported: RC_CH2 (unused when in CPPM mode, = 1), RC_CH8 (last channel in PWM mode, = 9)

vbat_maxcvolt.Description: maximum voltage per cell, used for auto-detecting battery voltage in 0.1V units, default is 43 (4.3V)

vbat_mincvolt.Description: minimum voltage per cell, this triggers battery out alarms, in 0.1V units, default is 33 (3.3V)

vbat_scale.Description: adjust this to match battery voltage to reported value

wp_radius.Description: if we are within this distance to a waypoint then we consider it reached (distance is in cm)
